Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel, showing remains of two lines of hieratic text written in black ink at the shoulder of the amphora and could therefore also be a jar label. The vessel is an imported amphora with a white slip at the outer surface and a lot of lime fragments in the clay, one handle is still largely preserved. The inside of the vessel is covered with a white substance.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.2, lower level
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 61)
